events.title: Coronation of King James I of England and VI of Scotland
events.description: James VI of Scotland is crowned King of England, uniting the crowns of England and Scotland.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of the Stuart era in England and the unification of the English and Scottish crowns under one monarch.

events.title: John C. Fremont reaches the summit of the Sierra Nevada
events.description: American explorer John C. Fremont reaches the summit of the Sierra Nevada mountains, helping to pave the way for westward expansion in the United States.
events.significance: This achievement contributed to the understanding and mapping of the American West, influencing migration and development.

events.title: Hiram Bingham rediscovers Machu Picchu
events.description: American explorer Hiram Bingham announces the discovery of the Incan city of Machu Picchu in Peru.
events.significance: Machu Picchu is one of the most important archaeological sites of the Inca civilization and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

events.title: Operation Gomorrah begins
events.description: The Allied bombing campaign against Hamburg, Germany, known as Operation Gomorrah, begins during World War II.
events.significance: The bombings caused massive destruction and civilian casualties, marking one of the most devastating air raids of the war.

events.title: Apollo 11 crew returns to Earth
events.description: The crew of Apollo 11, the first manned mission to land on the Moon, safely returns to Earth.
events.significance: This event marked the successful completion of humanity's first lunar landing mission, a major milestone in space exploration.
